intro: Entandrophragma congoense, commonly known as African shea or African butter tree, is a tropical tree native to central and western Africa. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its large, elongated leaves and showy, yellow-orange flowers. The tree produces a valuable fruit with a hard, oily seed that is used in traditional medicine and as a source of vegetable oil. Its ecological importance includes soil stabilization and providing habitat for various wildlife species.
